hanzi-su-wiki:
拷

Значения

Пытать, бить

Мнемоника

Допрашивать и бить 扌, пока арестант не одумается» 考.
purpleculture_pinyin:
kǎo
to beat; to flog; to examine under torture
бить; пороть; осматривать под пытками
rtega_mnemonic:
拷拷RStorture and interrogate, hit
  • interrogate 考 someone by hitting with the hand 扌: torture
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: To question 考 by hand 扌; 考 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
拷贝 [ kǎo bèi ]: copy; to copy (loanword)
拷问 [ kǎo wèn ]: to question via torture
拷打 [ kǎo dǎ ]: to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions); to give sb the third degree; to torture
绷巴吊拷 [ bèng bā diào kǎo ]: variant of 绷扒吊拷
绷扒吊拷 [ bèng bā diào kǎo ]: to strip, tie up, hang and beat sb, an ancient torture technique
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 考 [ kǎo ] to test, to investigate, to examine
heisig_chinese_memo: When you take an exam with shaky fingers and fail it in this school, you will get a good flog ging afterwaards.
heisig_constituent: torture, finger, fingers, consider, old man, slingshot, catapult
koohiiStory1: In Torture 101 class they teach you to Consider the Fingers as the first part to inflict pain to. Then you can move on to other parts (like feet, groin, head, etc. etc. ; ) ).
koohiiStory2: Aaaargh, stop! cries the victim of torture, his fingers being squeezed by the thumb screws. "I´ll consider it," the torturer says coolly, "if you tell me the names of all the agents in your organization.".
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You put your fingers in the coffin to tickle the beggar inside. What you're doing is a new form of torture.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: First, you put them in a coffin to make them think they're going to die. Then you tickle them with your fingers. There is no greater psychological + physical torture than this.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The beggar you will coffin tickle torture is ごういち, a.k.a. Grandpa Koichi. He is a frail old man, and doesn't like to be tickled.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: He keeps screaming: "STOP THIS TICKLE TORTURE. I CAN'T TAKE IT JUST BURY ME."
Ru_trainchinese: kǎo: (глаг) бить, истязать, пытать; копировать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you think (考) using your hands (扌) is torture
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When you take an exam with shaky fingers and fail it in this school, you will get a good flog ging afterwaards.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " hand " to the sound of " test ", it means torture. "Jade Pian‧ Hand": "Torture, beat." Yuan Shi Junbao "Qiuhu Drama Wife" third fold: "You have a soup and I have a soup, and you have tortured and cut your waist."

" Copy " mostly refers to the use of torture instruments to extract a confession. "Wei Shu‧ Penalty Records": "It uses a jingle to flatten its knots. The prisoner will have three points, the back of the rod will be two points, and the shin will be one point.

" Kao " is also used as an abbreviation for "silk copy", such as "yunxiang copy", "raw silk copy" and so on. "Kakishi" is a silk fabric dyed with yam solution, and is mostly used as summer clothes.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " hand ", the sound of " test " indicates torture.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「考」聲，表示拷打。《玉篇‧手部》：「拷，打也。」元石君寶〈秋胡戲妻〉第三折：「你湯我一湯，拷了你那腰截骨。」

　　「拷」多指用刑具逼供。《魏書‧刑罰志》：「其捶用荊，平其節，訊囚者其本大三分，杖背者二分，撻脛者一分，拷悉依令。」

　　「拷」也用作「拷綢」的略稱，如「雲香拷」、「生絲拷」等。「拷綢」為用薯莨液染的一种丝织品,多用作夏天衣裳。

Lesson: 34 frameNoV4: 1255 frameNoV6: 1344 Strokes: 9 Jouyou Grade: JH JLPT: 1
從「 手 」，「 考 」聲，表示拷打。《玉篇‧手部》：「拷，打也。」元石君寶〈秋胡戲妻〉第三折：「你湯我一湯，拷了你那腰截骨。」 「 拷 」多指用刑具逼供。《魏書‧刑罰志》：「其捶用荊，平其節，訊囚者其本大三分，杖背者二分，撻脛者一分，拷悉依令。」 「 拷 」也用作「拷綢」的略稱，如「雲香拷」、「生絲拷」等。「拷綢」為用薯莨液染的一种丝织品,多用作夏天衣裳。
From the " hand" to the sound of " test", it means torture. "Jade Pian‧ Hand": "Torture, beat." Yuan Shi Junbao "Qiuhu Drama Wife" third fold: "You have a soup and I have a soup, and you have tortured and cut your waist." " Copy" mostly refers to the use of torture instruments to extract a confession. "Wei Shu‧ Penalty Records": "It uses a jingle to flatten its knots. The prisoner will have three points, the back of the rod will be two points, and the shin will be one point. " Kao" is also used as an abbreviation for "silk copy", such as "yunxiang copy", "raw silk copy" and so on. "Kakishi" is a silk fabric dyed with yam solution, and is mostly used as summer clothes.

拷字的基本解释

拷
kǎo
打：拷打。拷问。拷掠（泛指刑讯）。三拷六问。

拷字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kǎo］
［《集韻》苦浩切，上晧，溪。］
(1)拷打。多指用刑逼供。
(2)拷绸的略称。
(3)见“拷”。

拷字的英文翻译

◎ 拷
beat, torture

拷字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　拷； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页428第16
【玉篇】苦老切【集韻】苦浩切，?音考。掠也，打也。

[①]［kǎo］
["Jiyun" bitter and holy cut, Shanghao, Xi. ]
(1) Torture. Refers to using torture to extract a confession.
(2) Abbreviation for copy silk.
(3) See "Copy ".

Radicals: 扌, 耂  (fingers, coffin, beggar)
Meaning Mnemonic
You put your fingers in the coffin to tickle the beggar inside. What you're doing is a new form of torture.
First, you put them in a coffin to make them think they're going to die. Then you tickle them with your fingers. There is no greater psychological + physical torture than this.
Reading Mnemonic
The beggar you will coffin tickle torture is ごういち, a.k.a. Grandpa Koichi. He is a frail old man, and doesn't like to be tickled.
He keeps screaming: "STOP THIS TICKLE TORTURE. I CAN'T TAKE IT JUST BURY ME."
